reviews.review_msg: Professor is knowledgeable and nice. Unfortunately the class content itself is very boring... Also, lots of readings to do each week. The class is more science/forensic sided rather than criminology sided. Not a bad class but not a great one either. I would not take another forensics class, but I wouldn't mind taking a class with Dr. Bell again.
She is very knowledgeable in her field. Even though her lectures can be boring, she is straightforward in what she wants in exams or papers. Nothing is vague.

do yourself a favor and take a class with dr. bell - she's literally an angel, so caring and understanding - especially about the TA strike this year she was extra lenient and made her lectures accessible. she marks really reasonable and her exams and papers are extremely straightforward. she's just such a sweetheart.

lectures incredibly boring, seemed like she did not want to be there or teach at all. not open to student questions-had a class dedicated to questions about the final exam and she didn't answer any-talked to students like they were stupid for asking. did not go into detail about course content as we should have been able to figure it out ourselves.
Terrible human being. Rude and inconsiderate. At one point, said that they don't believe in stats.

Dr. Bell definitely has a specific sense of humour that might not be for everyone, however, I really enjoyed this course and the content that was covered. You can also tell that Dr. Bell is very passionate about the work she does. Grades were based on two take home exams, a quiz, and a short news article critique. I recommend her.

The content itself is fairly easy to understand. Criteria for assignments and exams were broad and not very clear, resulting in lots of confusion. Lectures were boring and uninspiring but the readings themselves were surprisingly interesting (if you are interested in the field of forensics however). Exams were take home essays (emphasis on readings

This course was quite simple overall, not too dense or anything and she is very passionate about her field of work, which is great to see. My main criticism is that the criteria for assignments were very broad, and many students didn't do so well because of the lack of clear instruction. Besides that, the course is easy to comprehend!

Very patronizing well when students approach her with questions. Her assignments are easy but her instructions are poorly organized. She displayed discriminatory attitudes toward students from non-science backgrounds yet she is the one in a social science department. She is not equipped to be a lecturer in social science nor health science. Period

Gpa booster. Go to class and take notes aside from her powerpoint slides. Shes great at explaining the topic, even though it could get boring. Midterm was easy marks and only one final, which questions are given a week before. Prep for the final with all her ppt, notes you took in class, readings and you will do well.

1 take home midterm/essay, 1 super easy presentation, 1 critique on an article, and 1 pre-seen final with 3 straight forward essay questions. Can't get any better to be honest. Very different from 355 so lectures might be a little dry at times, but everything's online anyway so attendance isn't mandatory. Her stories are quite interesting.

One paper which you write on any topic related to Forensics. One easy presentation, and a take home test consisting of four essay questions. You are allowed to prepare/practice on these exam questions one week in advance, and you come on the day of the exam to write them. What's so hard about this? People expecting University to be a cake walk?

Boring topic, boring course. Relatively straightforward. Prof & TA were approachable enough, but very blunt. Not exactly a fun course, but definitely one where success is possible without too much effort.

Loved her & the TA. Expects you to be relatively self-sufficient by this time- won't hand hold!  She's super smart & passionate. Also funny! Final exam was three essay questions given a week in advance. Very easy in 2 hours. One paper, 3500 words, one presentation, one short article critique. No textbook. Really want to take another class with her.

Lectures posted online! Don't need to attend class ! no textbook.. Final exam Garbage!! 2 hours to write 3 essay questions?!!? are u kidding me? no point form, startin to feel like an english class!! gimme a break!! Avoid going to lectures, so dry and boring!!

Boring lectures!! Don't need to attend any lectures!! Recorded lectures posted up along with powerpoint slides!! midterm was a 40% take home paper.. final was 3 exam topics she gives you a week before to prepare for! I don't think the final exam was fair!  Have to prepare for all 3 exams She wants all answers in essay format, no point form! Bad!!!
